basics.name: Michael Engen
basics.label: Software Engineer
highlights: I am a full-stack software developer with nine years of experience using code to solve problems in scientific programming, data engineering, and web contexts
I experienced in Python and JavaScript to build responsive full-stack applications
Well versed in technical communication, including five published mathematical research papers and 18 mathematical research talks
basics.summary:
I am a detail-oriented software developer with 9 years of experience using code to solve problems in web development, data engineering, and scientific programming.

 I'm passionate about helping others with code, including developing full-stack monitoring solutions, writing technical documention, and working directly with users to identify product gaps. I care deeply about effective communication and have extensive experience, including six years spent teaching at the undergraduate level, five published novel mathematical research papers, and 18 talks on mathematical research.

 My personal devleopment projects include PermPy, an open-source Python library for working with combinatorial permutation patterns.

work.name: PayPal (remote)
highlightsOld: Assisted external developers in integrating with PayPal's software
Built product demos to showcase software features to external stakeholders
Improved internal and external documentation to aid knowledge transfer
highlightsNew: Collaborated with external developers to ensure a smooth integration of (WHAT PRODUCTS?) our products into their systems
Designed and developed an internal end-to-end testing tool, enabling quick and accurate testing of PayPal APIs and SDKs
Troubleshot complex integration issues, working directly with product and engineering teams
Streamlined integration certification and trained internal teams on products and processes
highlights: Collaborated with external developers to ensure a smooth integration of PayPal products into their systems
Designed and developed an internal end-to-end testing tool using Python and JavaScript, enabling simple and accurate testing of PayPal APIs and SDKs
Troubleshot complex integration issues, liaising between product, engineering, and external teams to quickly track down and resolve technical issues
Wrote developer-facing documentation and certification requirements to support and streamline integration processes

work.name: Bridgerock Data
highlights: Consulted with external stakeholders to discover their business-intelligence needs and created custom SQL-powered reports for analyzing key performance indicators
Implemented a new database and computing infrastructure for ETL processes using AWS EC2, ECS, and CloudFormation
Collaborated both remotely and in-person using an agile software development process and gained experience in a fast-paced startup work environment

work.name: University of Florida
highlights: Co-developed Xronos, an open-source online learning platform that empowers mathematics educators to create online homework assignments using LaTeX
Collected product feedback by meeting directly with instructors and students

work.name: Oak Ridge National Laboratory
highlights: Developed and implemented a frequent subgraph mining algorithm for extracting features from plaintext cancer pathology reports in Python
Utilized feature selection to improve classification rate of the automatic pathology reporting

work.name: University of Florida
highlights: Developed curriculum and instructed students, both in group settings and one-on-one
Measured students' performance through proctored assessments both in-person and remotely

projects.name: PermPy
projects.description: PermPy is an open-source Python library for generating and analyzing large combinatorial datasets.
highlightsOld: Co-authored an open-source Python library for generating and analyzing large combinatorial datasets
Utilized PermPy to perform computations for numerous published and in-preparation mathematical research articles
Empowered young researchers with accessible software tools to use in their own computational research
highlights: Implemented unit tests, CI/CD, and programmatically generated documentation
Empowered young researchers with accessible software tools to use in their own computational research
